titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Jacques de Launay Papers, 1914-1993
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Jacques de Launay Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, clippings, and other printed matter, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century European history, and especially to Romania and Belgium during World War II; the Little Entente; the relationship between Adolf Hitler and Lord Rothermere, 1933-1939; the Walloon Legion during World War II; and education in Europe. Includes sound recordings of interviews by J. de Launay of Tadeusz Komorowski, Andre Francois-Poncet, Georges Bonnet, and Jules Moch.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.
One folder in Box 3 may not be quoted without permission of J. de Launay.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jacques de Launay Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

SUBJECT FILE, 1919-1947
Avramovski, A., "An Attempt to Transform the `Petite Entente' Into a Pact of Mutual Assistance Against All Aggression" (in French)

"Central Europe in the Policy of Great Powers in the Period 1919-1939/41", Warsaw, 1970
"Joseph Beck's Voyage in Romania in October 1938" (in French), Polish Institute for International Affairs, Warsaw, 1960

"The Position of the `Petite Entente' in Relation to the Austro-German Tariff Union Plan" (in French), reprint, Nouvelles Etudes D'Histoire (Bucharest), 1965

"The Foreign Policy of Romania and the Dynamics of Peace, 1932-1936", reprint, Revue Roumaine D'Historie (Bucharest), Vol. 1, No. 1, 1966

Walloon Legion (Legion Wallonie), 1941-44, clippings
WRITINGS, 1959, 1975
"The Future and Professional Education of Youth in Europe" (in French), Brussels, 1959
"Secret Stories of Belgium, 1935-1945" (in French), Part III, with annotations by Leon Degrelle, Paris, 1975
INCREMENT, 1975
SUBJECT FILE

Launay, Jacques de: "La Correspondence secrete Hitler-Rothermere," 1933-1939. (Unpublished study of the most important correspondence between Lord Rothermere, editor of the Daily Mail, London, and Adolf Hitler, mainly concerning German-English and German-French relations in the 1930's, etc.
INCREMENT, 1978
SUBJECT FILE
Besse, Fernand
"Position des travailleurs Chretiens en matiere d'Apprentissage" (in French), mimeographed, Journees europeennes d'information sur la formation professionnelle de jeunes, n.p., n.d.

"Extraits de presse obtenus et en Belgique a partir du 15 Mai 1962" (in French), newspaper clippings, La Lanterne, and other newspapers, 1962
Bureau European de la Jeunesse et de l'enfance
Documents (in French), published, (Bruxelles), 1952-1956. Printed copies.

"Une experience de formation humaine dans une ecole professionnelle" (in French), Journees Europeennes sur la formation professionnelle des jeunnes (Geneve), Juillet 1950. Printed copy.

"Le Federalisme" (in French), La Federation, Paris, n.d. Printed copy.
"Les forces armees de la Federation Europeenne" (in French), n.p., n.d. Printed copy.
Guebriant, M. de,
"La formation professionnelle agricole" (in French), Supplement, Chambres d'Agriculture, Septembre-Octobre 1952 (Fontaineblau). Printed copy.
Hitler, Adolf

Babtisme de Feu de Adolf Hitler (in German), correspondence (in English and German) related to the battles in August 1914, in which Hitler participated as a volunteer. The correspondence took place between Col. Earl, British Armed Forces and Dr. Otto Schwend, German Officer, photostat copies except for one original letter. Includes 5 photographs, 1914-1970
Adolf Hitler's letter to Joseph Popp (in German), photograph, with a typewritten French translation, 1914.

"Localisation des aquarelles de Hitler" (in French), 6 photographs and 2 xerox copies of Hitler's paintings; 12 photographs of people, houses, scenes. A newspaper clipping (in French), showing and with information relative to one of Hitler's paintings "Houbourdin," January 16, 1976
International Labour Conference, Conference internationale du Travail, "Recommendation 87," 32d session, July 1, 1949 (in English and French), n.p., n.d. Printed copy.
Launay, Jacques de, and Bourgeois, Henri. "L'utilisation des gaz asphyxiants 1914-1918" (in French), a typewritten list.
Lousse, Emile. A resume (in French), n.d. Typewritten copy.
Mouvement Francais pour les Etats-Unis d'Europe. "Note d'information" (in French), Lille, n.d. Printed copy.
"L'Orientation professionnelle en France" (in French), La Documentation Francaise. Notes et etudes documentaires. (Paris), 12 Septembre 1950
Principaux traits caracteristiques de l'apprentissage en Italie" (in French), Fournees Europeennes d'Information sur la Formation Professionnelle des Jeunnes, Avril 1950.
Union Europeenne des Federalistes, 2e annuel Congres de, (in French), Rome, 6-11 Novembre 1948, printed & mimeographed, programs, motions, resolutions, 1948.
Venlo, L'Incident de, (in French), photostat, n.p., n.d. Photocopy (typescript).
BOR-KOMOROVSKI, General - "L'Insurrection de Varsovie", Enregistrement réalisé à Londres par J. de Launay, 13 Decembre 1960.
FRANÇOIS-PONCET, A. - "Ma Mission Auprès du Duce (1938-39)", Enregistrement réalisé chez M. François-Poncet, Paris, 1 Mars 1958.
BONNET, Georges - "La Periode 1933-39 - Souvenirs", Enregistrement réalisé à Bergneustadt (RFA) par J. de Launay, 26 Avril 1957.
MOCH, Jules - "La Naissance du Front Populaire 1936", Enregistrement réalisé à Lausanne par J. de Launay, 1 avril 1959.
